unnormalised: **Telecommunications: Fiber-to-Home Expansion Gains Momentum in India**
normalised: telecommunications colon fiber to home expansion gains momentum in india

unnormalised: New Delhi, India â€“ Telecom providers across India are significantly expanding their Fiber-to-Home (FTTH) infrastructure, aiming to deliver high-speed internet access to a wider consumer base. Reliance Jio continues its ambitious rollout across the country, targeting an additional 100,000 km of fiber optic cable laid by the end of FY24.

unnormalised: Bharti Airtel is also aggressively competing, particularly in Tier 2 and Tier 3 cities like Lucknow and Jaipur. The company recently announced a partnership with local cable operators to facilitate faster deployment in densely populated areas.

unnormalised: Analysts at IIM Ahmedabad predict a 35% year-on-year growth in FTTH subscriptions, driven by the increasing demand for streaming services and online education. The "3 Idiots" era dependence on unreliable broadband is fading fast, with families now demanding seamless connectivity.
normalised: analysts at I I M ahmedabad predict a thirty five percent year on year growth in F T T H subscriptions comma driven by the increasing demand for streaming services and online education period the "three idiots" era dependence on unreliable broadband is fading fast comma with families now demanding seamless connectivity period

unnormalised: State-owned BSNL is also revamping its FTTH offerings, hoping to regain market share. The government's BharatNet project aims to connect all gram panchayats with high-speed internet, further boosting FTTH infrastructure development nationwide. Investment in the sector is estimated to be upwards of Rs. 20,000 crore in the coming year.
